author: Christian Brake

commands.description: Search for public users on Twitter
commands.name: twitter-get-users

commands.description: Lookup users by name to display information about them. Search multiple users simultaneously by separating them by commas. Ex: "name="user1,user2,user3"
commands.name: twitter-get-user-info

integration.description: The Twitter Integration allows users to parse Twitter for Users, Tweets, and additional info about users. Perform enhanced searches with additional search arguments. Search results are returned as a markdown table.
integration.name: Twitter (Community Contribution)

description: A simple integration that uses Twitter's API to perform searches on twitter for tweets, users, and user information.
name: Twitter
readme:
## Example of Potential Use Cases
### Search for potentially fraudulent accounts:

As a company with a social media presence, we need to prevent fraud accounts from impersonating our company in order to protect the corporate reputation. We also want to allow customers to do the same. In order to achieve this, we need a reliable way to detect and report fraudulent accounts. To achieve this, we will create an integration that allows XSOAR to connect to Twitterâ€™s API. We will create a searching feature with customizable filters (such as searching by name, keywords, verified status), to allow us to better find the results we are looking for. As we search for fraud accounts, we will support the ability to add benign accounts to a list to be excluded from further searches. These two means of filtration will allow us to efficiently search for and report fraudulent accounts.
